name: Create a Users, and Groups
description: Walkthrough on creating users and groups in your tenancy.

steps.message:
In this tutorial we will guide you on how to create users and groups. You can also add users to groups.
A user's permissions to access services come from the groups which they belong to. The permissions given to a group is called a policy which we'll discuss later. Tip: Only users with user creation policies can create users.

With the side menu open. Scroll down to "Identity" and click "Users".
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/iduser.png}}
Click "Create User" button. Enter the Name of the user, a brief description, and an email for password recovery. Click "Create button."

Now a user has been created! Next we will create a group.
Tip: A user won't have access to resources until they are added to groups with policies specifying proper permissions.

Click the menu button on top left. Scroll down to "Identity" and click "Groups".
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/idgroups.png}}

Click Create Group button. Enter the "Name" and "Description" of the group.
Click Submit. Tip: You can create groups by business organization or roles such as admin vs read only users. {{img-url:/images/tutorials/idgroups2.png}}

Once a group is created, users should be added. Click on the new created group name. Click "AddUser to Group".
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/idaddusers.png}}

On the list add the users to this specific group. All users within the same group will now have the same privileges depending on the policy given to the group.
Congratulations finished the first tutorial on IAM!
Tip: Users require one-time passwords in order to access console and work with compartments. For this tutorial see User Credentials.
